data.title: Every Single Thought We Had While Listening to BeyoncÃ©â€™s New Album Cowboy Carter
data.meta_description: Glamour staff gathered on the day of the release of BeyoncÃ©'s "Cowboy Carter" to review and listen and share our thoughts.
data.text:
Yeeâ€”I can't emphasize this enoughâ€”haw.

On Friday, BeyoncÃ© released Cowboy Carter, her latest album. The second in what she has promised to be a trio of albums starting with 2022's Renaissance, Cowboy Carter, the 27 tracks make up a dizzying, genre-bending, and eclectic work that draws from history, country, and rock for its unique sound.

To mark this cultural moment, members of the Glamour staff gathered on the day of the album's release to listen to it together for the first time, and share our impressions as we went along. Here are our thoughts, completely unfiltered, about every single track.

Instagram content

This content can also be viewed on the site it originates from.

Track 1: â€œAmerican Requiemâ€

â€œThe harmony!â€ â€”Jazmin Gathers, social media manager

â€œSounds like Buffalo Springfield.â€ â€”Sam Reed, senior trending news and entertainment editor

â€œIs it weird I think it's giving Beatles? This is really giving me Beatles late-â€™60s vibes.â€ â€”Chantal Waldholz, senior director, audience development

â€œDo you think she went on a George Harrisonâ€“esque journey with psychedelics? I hope so.â€ â€”SR

â€œOkay, I'm in love with this. Reminds me of â€˜Cardinalsâ€™ by Kacey Musgraves with that zombies-like guitar. Bring back the '60s!â€ â€”SR

â€œSasha Fierce Lonely Hearts Club Band.â€ â€”Danielle Sinay, associate beauty editor

Track 2: â€œBlackbirdâ€(Beatles Cover)

â€œSome important context for â€˜Blackbirdâ€™: Paul McCartney wrote it in the â€™60s in support of the Civil Rights Movement. â€˜I was sitting around with my acoustic guitar and Iâ€™d heard about the civil rights troubles that were happening in the â€™60s in Alabama, Mississippi, Little Rock in particular,â€™ McCartney told GQ. â€˜I just thought it would be really good if I could write something that if it ever reached any of the people going through those problems, it might give them a little bit of hope. So, I wrote â€˜Blackbird.â€™â€ â€”Anna Moeslein, deputy editor

â€œOkay, but now I want to know...when are we getting a Bey/Paul/Ringo performance.â€ â€”SR

â€œWhy am I on the verge of tears.â€ â€”DS

â€œBeyoncÃ© covering â€˜Blackbirdâ€™ is really going to feed the modern dance community for years to come.â€ â€”Anastasia Sanger, senior manager, social video development

â€œDoes anyone else think of a line from The Sisterhood of the Traveling Pants where Lena sneaks out of her room to meet up with Kostos and she writes that Lena was thinking of the lyrics â€˜You were only waiting for this moment to be free,â€™ or are you normal?â€ â€”SR

â€œI think we're all going to need to take a half day after this.â€ â€”CW

Track 3: â€œ16 Carriagesâ€

â€œThe lyrics in this song.â€ â€”Monique Wilson, editorial assistant

â€œShe's always been such a good lyricist, but this album so far is next level.â€ â€”CW

â€œVery upsetting to be listening to this in an office instead of on a road trip through the desert.â€ â€”AS

Track 4: â€œProtectorâ€

â€œRumiiiii.â€ â€”SR

"New father-daughter dance ballad just dropped. Even though I know one day youâ€™re gonna shine on your own / I will be your projector.â€ â€”DS

â€œAs a new mom I was not emotionally prepared for â€˜Protectorâ€™ today.â€ â€”AM

â€œThe projector/protector rhyme would be cheap if it was anyone else.â€ â€”AS

Track 5: â€œMy Roseâ€

â€œI like 'My Rose a lot.â€ â€”MW

Track 6: â€œSmoke Hourâ€ (feat. Willie Nelson)

â€œIf Willie tells me to smoke during work hours, do I listen.â€ â€”SR

â€œI like to imagine that BeyoncÃ© and Willie had a good weed sesh.â€ â€”CW

Track 7: â€œTexas Hold â€™Emâ€

â€œI somehow like â€˜Texas Hold â€™Em nowâ€™ MUCH more in the context of the album at large. I cried now I'm ready to danceâ€ â€”DS

â€œThe BeyoncÃ© way.â€ â€”CW

â€œTake me to the rodeo please.â€ â€”MW

â€œGoogles cowboy hats for pets.â€ â€”DS

â€œI loathed square dancing during elementary school, but if I were there now and they used this song for it, I'd give it my all.â€ â€”CW

Instagram content

This content can also be viewed on the site it originates from.

Track 8: â€œBodyguardâ€

â€œVibe shift!â€ â€”DS

â€œSo nice of Bey to dedicate a song to Julius.â€ â€”Ariana Yaptango, senior beauty editor

â€œOf course thereâ€™s already a rumor that Taylor Swift did the backing vocals for â€˜Bodyguard.â€™â€ â€”AM

â€œBeyoncÃ© doesnâ€™t drop albums she drops SOUNDTRACKS. Like wedding culture will never be the same.â€ â€”DS

â€œâ€˜Bodyguardâ€™ is also giving me Stevie Nicks.â€ â€”AS

â€œVibey AF.â€ â€”SR

â€œâ€˜Bodyguardâ€™ needs to be her next single. Suuuuuch a good summer track.â€ â€”CW

Track 9: â€œDolly Pâ€ (feat. Dolly Parton)

â€œOh LOL Dolly really did mention the â€˜hussy with the good hair.â€™â€ â€”DS

â€œI think I could create a whole college syllabus around Dolly and her impact. She is a LEGEND.â€ â€”AM

â€œOops, I accidentally had â€˜Dolly Pâ€™ looping on repeat and was likeâ€¦this is an artistic choice!â€ â€”DS

Track 10: â€œJoleneâ€ (Dolly Parton Cover)

â€œOoh she changed up the lyrics. They're more savage lmao.â€ â€”SR

â€œThe greatest mystery of our time who is Becky With the Good Hair.â€ â€”AY

â€œThe hussy with the good hair! Full circle.â€ â€”AM

â€œLet the conspiracy theories START.â€ â€”CW

Track 11: â€œDaughterâ€

â€œUMMMM? BeyoncÃ© CAN SING OPERA?????â€ â€”AS

â€œâ€˜This marijuana smoke smell in my hairâ€™: confirmation of Willie Nelson smoke sesh? Lol.â€ â€”DS

Track 12: â€œSpaghettiiâ€

â€œThe inclusion of Shaboozey: Heâ€™s known for bridging hip hop and country.â€ â€”AM

â€œShe's basically hitting EVERY genre and showing she can do it all. Actually dismantling the definition of genre.â€ â€”CW

â€œThis album really has a song for your sun, moon, rising, Mars, Mercury, Mars, Chironâ€¦â€ â€”DS

â€œShe has eyes on us.â€ â€”DS

â€œOkay 'no sauce' is hitting the right spot in my brain.â€ â€”SR

Track 13: â€œAlligator Tearsâ€

â€œI need to know who this is about.â€ â€”CW

â€œI love this one.â€ â€”JG

Track 14: â€œSmoke Hour IIâ€ (feat. Willie Nelson)

â€œI just want to note that Willie Nelson is 90 years old!â€ â€”AS

Track 15: â€œJust for Funâ€ (feat. Willie Jones)

â€œâ€˜I just need to get through thisâ€™â€”TY for the new anxiety attack anthem queen.â€ â€”AS

â€œNo but these harmonies are insane.â€ â€”JG

Instagram content

This content can also be viewed on the site it originates from.

Track 16: â€œII Most Wantedâ€ (feat. Miley Cyrus)

â€œMiley popping on for the first time gave me chills. We better get a â€˜Telephoneâ€™ level music video out of this.â€ â€”AS

â€œMILELLEKEEYYYYYYYYY. Sorry I lost control of myself there.â€ â€”DS

â€œSobbing thinking of riding shotgun in my bestie's car in high school.â€ â€”AS

â€œDown the 405!!! (But also what time? 4 am? How was there no traffic?)â€ â€”DS

â€œI feel so blessed to live in this timeline.â€ â€”AS

â€œThis might be my fave thus far. But Iâ€™m a sucker for collabsâ€”â€˜Let the Light Inâ€™ with Father John Misty was also my fav off Lanaâ€™s most recent album.â€ â€”DS, known Lanita

â€œThis is my favorite. It feels like it's about time passing by, or doing too things early in life, but having someone with you making all the difference whether its a partner or a friend (in my mind itâ€™s giving best-friend anthem).â€ â€”Jenifer Calle, senior commerce editor

Track 17: â€œLeviiâ€™s Jeansâ€ (feat. Post Malone)

â€œNo I'm sorry I hate Post Malone on thisâ€¦This is the worst part of the album.â€ â€”AS

â€œYeah so far this is the weakest song on the album for me.â€ â€”CW

â€œOkay this is a vibe shift.â€ -DS

â€œEw I can't I'm sorry Post gives me the ick. This song is gonna be in a terrible rom-com.â€ â€”AS

â€œPost's part sounds like the â€˜back seat of your roverâ€™ band? 'Baby pull me closer in the back seat of your rover' whatever theyâ€™re called. [Editorâ€™s note: That would be The Chainsmokers].â€ â€”DS

â€œIDK this song is giving me Y2K vibes for some reason.â€ â€”JG

â€œI liked it. ğŸ˜©ğŸ˜¬â€ â€”Stephanie McNeal, senior editor

Track 18: â€œFlamencoâ€

â€œI think we are all recovering from the Post Malone jump scare.â€ â€”DS

Track 19: â€œThe Linda Martell Showâ€ (feat. Linda Martell)

â€œAs usual BeyoncÃ© is so strategic and genius in her references. For those who donâ€™t know Linda was a trailblazer for Black female country artists.â€ â€”AM

â€œThatâ€™s how you know sheâ€™s a Virgo. She strategizes like no other.â€ â€”DS

â€œEVERYTHING is intentional. Sheâ€™s shown us that time and time again through her career.â€ â€”AM

Track 20: â€œYa Yaâ€

â€œMy husband just walked in on me dancing to this.â€ â€”DS

â€œReferencing â€˜These Boots Are Made for Walkingâ€™ and â€˜Good Vibrationsâ€™â€”along with her cover of â€˜Blackbird,â€™ BeyoncÃ© is really bringing the '60s back.â€ â€”AS

â€œâ€˜These Boots Are Made For Walkingâ€™ sampleâ€”yee-fucking-haw.â€ â€”SR

â€œThis is also giving me Tina Turner.â€ â€”JG

â€œI think my dad will actually like this album.â€ â€”SR

â€œI texted my dad to listen!!! That's so funny.â€ â€”CW

â€œCowboy Carter is for girls with That Dad.â€ â€”SR

â€œIâ€™m scared to tell my dad to listen. I feel like heâ€™ll implode. And also, keep buying larger and larger cowboy hats (itâ€™s already an issue).â€ â€”DS

Track 21: â€œOh Louisianaâ€

â€œAll the â€™60s nods throughout has to be intentional nod to Civil Rights Movement Ã  la â€˜Blackbirdâ€™â€™s early inclusion, Linda was the first Black woman to play the Grand Old Opry in 1969â€¦.â€ â€”AM

â€œThis album is also very funny. BeyoncÃ© is a comedian.â€ â€”AY

â€œShe sounds like she's having so much fun.â€ â€”MW

Track 22: â€œDesert Eagleâ€

â€œBassline is giving Thundercat.â€ â€”AS

â€œItâ€™s extremely Beatles again.â€ â€”DS

â€œRIP John Lennon you would've loved Cowboy Carter.â€ â€”AS

Track 23: â€œRiiverdanceâ€

â€œThe most Renaissance-y beat of the album so far.â€ â€”AS

â€œIâ€™m so sorry butâ€¦idk whyâ€¦I just keep hearing â€˜Grind With Meâ€™ because of the bass.â€ â€”DS

â€œAgain I am just here to sayâ€¦ these harmoniesâ€¦I have not recovered.â€ â€”JG

â€œThis album is such a rich text of historical Easter eggs; my inner librarian is enjoying digging through them all.â€ â€”AM

â€œI think this might be her strongest album lyrically too? Or maybe riiiight after Lemonade.â€ â€”CW

â€œI can smell Album of the Year. This is the one.â€ â€”AY

Track 24: â€œII Hands II Heavenâ€

â€œShe mentions Arizona in this song and I just want to know what a day in Arizona looks like for Bey and Jay.â€ â€”SR

â€œAlso lots of references specifically to sitting in the front seatâ€”feet on the dashboard, riding shotgun. Love that sheâ€™s a Passenger Princess but whenâ€™s the last time she realistically sat in front.â€ â€”DS

â€œDoes BeyoncÃ© still have a driver's license?â€ â€”AM

Instagram content

This content can also be viewed on the site it originates from.

Track 25: â€œTyrantâ€ (feat. Dolly Parton)

â€œThis has me boppinâ€™.â€ â€”DS

â€œOoo this might be top five.â€ â€”JG

â€œAnother summer bop for sure.â€ â€”CW

Track 26: â€œSweet Honey Buckinâ€ (feat. Shaboozey)

â€œThere's a Patsy Cline reference/sample. Patsy also a country genre disrupter, one of the first country music artists to cross over into pop music.â€ â€”AS

â€œThis is peak â€˜walking around pretending like youâ€™re in a movieâ€™ music.â€ â€”DS

â€œSorry to be the one to say this but this album could've used an edit.â€ â€”SR

â€œ'Look at that horse' is sending me.â€ â€”DS

â€œThere are like three different genres in this one song.â€ â€”CW

Track 27: â€œAmenâ€

â€œMore Virgo planning â€”the first song ends with her saying â€˜Amen,â€™ and the album ends with a song called â€˜Amen.â€™â€ â€”AS

Okay, everyone, so how do you feel?

â€œI'm gonna go take a half day now to recover.â€ â€”CW

â€œWhat a time.â€ â€”JG

â€œGoing to listen again; itâ€™s my new soundtrack of summer.â€ â€”DS

â€œI'm still a Renaissance girl but songs from this will definitely be playing all summer for me. The way this album will be blasting in Washington Square Park on 4/20â€¦.â€ â€”AS

â€œOnce again, BeyoncÃ© made listening to a new album an emotional experience. (Seriously, I remember exactly where I was when I first listened to BeyoncÃ©, Lemonade, Renaissance). And if you would have told young meâ€”whoâ€™s first CD purchase was Dangerously in Loveâ€”that I would fall in love with a country album by her, she would not have believed you, but here I am basically in tears from this album (lol). She proves music can transcend genres, that you can fine-tune your art later in life, that thereâ€™s so many levels to the history of country music, and to just have fun.â€ â€”JC

â€œThis is one of her strongest albums lyrically. I am amazed how she incorporated several different genres in a song. Just further cementing herself as one of the greatest artists of all time. I now have to recover. Also, Jay Z is the luckiest man in the world and I hope he knows that!â€ â€”CW

â€œToo bad my cowboy boots always make me throw my back out.â€ â€”DS
